intro: Disakisperma mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions. Its foliage is often gray-green, with hairy surfaces that help reduce water loss. Disakisperma mexicanum is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
